overview.title: A Change of Heart
overview.synopsis: A dying Edgerunner hires the player for a data extraction. The mission uncovers a tragedy of corporate negligence and a haunting choice.
overview.tone: Tragic Noir. Gritty, rain-soaked, and emotionally heavy.
overview.visualStyle: Diegetic Interface. The player views the world through a high-contrast HUD. Look for the 'Lattice' glitch.
overview.playerCount: 1 (Duet Style) - Best for a Tech/Netrunner archetype

lore.projectHeirloom: A Bio-Dyne breeding program from 30 years ago. Goal: Create humans with durable organs for labor. Result: Subjects have above-average organ strength and longevity, but Bio-Dyne engineered two failsafes.
lore.typeH: All Heirloom subjects have 'Type-H' blood - an artificial blood type incompatible with normal transfusions. They can only receive organs from other Type-H donors.
lore.geneticTimebomb: Bio-Dyne engineered a genetic killswitch. Without a suppressant compound in the water supply, subjects begin terminal organ failure after ~10 years. The water treatment stopped 15 years ago when Bio-Dyne abandoned the project.
lore.theGasLeak: The official story: An industrial accident 15 years ago. The truth: Bio-Dyne used nerve gas to liquidate the subjects before selling the land to Omni-Global. But some survived.
lore.theMystery: All surviving Heirloom subjects are now falling ill simultaneously - regardless of age, gender, or lifestyle. The genetic timebomb has gone off. There is no cure. No hospital can help them.
lore.elenaHistory: Elena (Subject 01) was the Control Subject - kept pristine while others were tested. When the liquidation order came, she was in a biocell awaiting experimental treatment. The raiders cleared the building but missed her room - the entrance was concealed behind a maintenance panel. She has been in stasis for 15 years, frozen mid-treatment, waiting for a cure that never came.
lore.theStingInTheTail: Even if Jax receives Elena's heart, the genetic timebomb is not cured. Her organs will slow his decline, but the killswitch is in his DNA. All Elena's sacrifice buys him is time. Months. Maybe a year. The tragedy is complete.
lore.jaxHistory: Jax was born 'Subject 89'. At age 15, he traded the ventilation codes to the mercs for his freedom, unknowingly helping them gas his own neighborhood. Now the timebomb is killing him.
lore.theHazers: Survivors of the gas living in the ruin. They are all dying from the same genetic timebomb. They protect the zone as a tomb - and soon, their own.
lore.theGhost: Elena is not a supernatural ghost. She is a glitched user profile. Her neural link has been active for 15 years, creating a directory of 'dreams' in the local system.
lore.theMark: The Lattice. A faint honeycomb pattern in the eyes of all subjects. Establish this early with Jax, then reveal it on the Hazers.
lore.theBetrayal: Jax didn't know about the gas. He thought he was helping an eviction. The proof is on the keycard he carries.

timeline.event: Project Heirloom begins. Bio-Dyne creates the first Type-H subjects.
Elena is born as Subject 01 - the Control Subject.
Jax (Subject 89) is born in the Oakhaven block.
Bio-Dyne begins adding the suppressant compound to the water supply.

timeline.label: THE LIQUIDATION
timeline.event: Bio-Dyne orders the project terminated. Jax (age 15) trades vent codes for a transit pass. Mercenaries use nerve gas to kill the subjects.
Elena is in a biocell awaiting treatment when the raid begins. Raiders miss her concealed room. She remains in stasis.
Water treatment stops. The genetic timebomb begins its countdown.
Some subjects survive the gas. They become the Hazers.
The timebomb activates. Heirloom subjects begin experiencing organ failure.

timeline.label: PRESENT DAY
timeline.event: Jax is 30. His heart is failing. He hires the player for one last job.
All surviving Heirloom subjects are dying simultaneously. The Hazers are falling. There is no cure.

allies.name: Jaxson 'Jax' V.
allies.description: Edgerunner. 30 years old. Dying of the genetic timebomb. Type-H blood. Charismatic but desperate.
allies.secret: He is Subject 89. He betrayed his people 15 years ago. No hospital can save him - he needs a Type-H donor.

enemies.name: Rattle
enemies.description: Wears a heavy gas mask. Voice box destroyed by gas. Protective of the ruins.

enemies.name: Hazer Sentinel
enemies.description: Sickly survivors in scavenged hazmat gear.

neutral.name: Elena (Subject 01)
neutral.description: A woman in cryo-stasis. Type-H blood. She was in a biocell awaiting treatment when the liquidation happened - the raiders missed her hidden room. She's been frozen for 15 years.

items.title: Item Database
items.description: Key items, clutter, and loot that can be found or referenced during the adventure.

content.name: Rusted Maintenance Chip
content.description: Jax's 'lucky charm'. A corroded access chip from 15 years ago.
content.data_content: Log #4092: User 89 authorized ventilation reversal. Timestamp: 15 years ago.
content.location: Jax carries this. Can be pickpocketed or given willingly.

content.name: Bio-Dyne Pure (Empty)
content.description: A yellowed plastic bottle. The label reads 'Bio-Dyne Pure - Fortified Water'. Chemical residue inside.
content.data_content: Lab analysis reveals trace amounts of an unknown compound - possibly a stabilizer or suppressant.
content.location: Found at the Shrine offerings (Scene 3) or on Hazer bodies.

content.name: Faded Photo
content.description: A photo of a 15-year-old boy. Facial recognition matches Jaxson V. with 99.9% accuracy.
content.location: Wall of the Missing in the Shrine (Scene 3).

content.name: Medical Logs
content.description: Printouts listing 'Genetic Organ Failure' as cause of death for dozens of people - all within the same month.
content.data_content: The dates match the present day. The same thing is happening to Jax.
content.location: Found in the Shrine (Scene 3) on failed Investigate check.

content.name: Fresh Air Filter
content.description: A clean air filter, still sealed. Given by Rattle as a blessing.
content.location: Given by Rattle in the Mercy ending (Scene 7).

content.name: Empty Bio-Dyne Pure Bottle
content.description: An empty water bottle with faded corporate branding.

content.name: Scrap Components
content.description: Salvageable electronics and metal. Worth a few credits.

content.name: Filtered Water
content.description: One bottle of filtered water. Safe to drink.

content.name: Old Family Photo
content.description: A worn photo of a family. The faces are smiling. They're all dead now.

clues.title: Clue Database
clues.description: Information the player can discover that advances the mystery.

content.name: Jax Was Here
content.description: Jax lived in Oakhaven 15 years ago. He was a child when the massacre happened.

content.name: The Genetic Timebomb
content.description: All the Oakhaven residents are dying of the same genetic condition - simultaneous organ failure.

content.name: Bio-Dyne Water
content.description: Bio-Dyne distributed 'fortified' water to Oakhaven. The water contained a suppressant compound.

content.name: The Terminal Logs
content.description: Jax traded the ventilation codes to Bio-Dyne mercenaries. They used them to pump nerve gas.

content.name: The Chip Logs
content.description: Jax's 'lucky charm' contains logs proving he authorized the ventilation reversal.
